////////// My configuration: /////////////////////
1. Eclipse platform Version: 2.1.0 Build id: 200303272130
2. Besides the standard plugins came with Eclispse platform, I've installed the
following plugin: 
  - PHPEclipse Tools Core (1.0.9) 
  - PHPEclipse SQL Utility (1.0.1)

///////// How did the problem rise: ///////////////
1. I'm doing a PHP project on another machine (mounted the remote directory with
NFS to my local disk). 

2. The remote computer reboot without closing Eclipse properly. And then Eclipse
goes dead ("ps afx" command reveals that the status of Eclipse's main thread is
"D" (uninterrupted IO process? not sure...) ) 

3. I "kill" all its child-threads by force, but I was not able to kill its main
thread.

4. The remote computer done its reboot, and Eclipse threads got killed
automatically.

5. I re-open Eclipse and the project,  and I found all my bookmarks and tasks
disappeared...  (All other settings, like short-cut keys, are working fine)


this is TOO bad because there were more than 50 of them over there... I'm
reading the source code written by another guy, and those bookmarks are really
important to me. Is it possible to restore them?

Can anyone help? Big thanks in advance!

Bookmarks, tasks and problems are all types of markers. In general markers are
saved at 2 points in time, when the workbench is exited and during a snapshot.
Snapshots occur:
- after a specified period of time (configured by Window -> Prefrences ->
Workbench -> Workspace save interval)
- after a specific number of workspace operations (this is internal)
- after a particularly "important" workspace operation (e.g. when a project is
first created, etc)

When you restarted Eclipse, you should have had the bookmarks from your last
save/snapshot. Is there any information in your log file
(/workspace/.metadata/.log) that would indicate why you don't have any?

Thanks for helping. 

I've tried to search some keywords like "bookmark", "mark" or "task" (and sth
like that) in the .log file but no clues are found so far... However, there're
some problems about "restoring editor", and I quote them below (some odd

Sorry if this commend is too long... Or will that be better if  I upload my

Thanks a lot!

Neither of those stack traces are related - one is due to a missing file in the
PHP  SQL plug-in. The other is due to open editors whose input has been deleted
since the last session (or input that is not accessible due to an unavailable
file system). Can you zip up your entire log file and attach it (use the "create
new attachment" link near the top of the page).

Created an attachment (id=7249)
My entire Log file

Sorry, I should have added this comment when uploading attachment...

I'm not sure at what time did the error occured. Actually Eclipse went "dead"
several times due to the breaking of NFS mount (I didn't realize what the reason
was at first) I hope Eclipse won't delete the out-of-date log items. 

Well, I've given up to recover my original bookmarks and tasks. However, I will
be happy to see this bug be caught :) Thanks a lot!

The most interesting entry in the log file is the NPE coming from a paint
callback.  I can believe that this might cause Eclipse to go dead. I don't see
how this would be related to the NFS mount, but it's the only concrete error
information available in your log.  Moving to platform text.

The NPE has been fixed a while ago in the current stream and I could now close
the bug, however, reading the PR, the connection (mount point) on which the
workspace is located got lost and from comment 1 I would conclude that the
markers were not saved until that time. So, let's assume the NPE no longer
happens (i.e. is fixed) how would this solve the problem described in this bug?

Note: even if opening the editor fails: it did not happen on startup (see stack
trace) and hence the markers should be available in the corresponding views. Do
they?

Moving back to Platform Core, either to close or further investigate.

If the crash happened before a snapshot was taken, then the markers would not
appear after the crash.

I'm closing this since we haven't seen this behaviour repeated and have been
unable to reproduce the problem. Please reopen if you encounter this again using
recent builds.
